text: Temporary solution (till they fix this) is to create the blog post variation like a new blog post and then add it to the multilanguage group

Hello ! I have an issue with local development tool for CMS. I created my own template and use Github Actions to deploy updates automatically when I update my theme repository on Github. I was using API KEY before it was depreciated, now I try to migrate the authentification with PERSONAL ACCESS KEY
Now when I try to deploy my updates I got the message : "The account "***" is configured to use a access key for authentication and is missing a "personalAccessKey" in the configuration file"

Is anyone encountered this issue here and know have to fix it ?
Did you remember to add the personal access key to secrets in GitHub?

Also, is the `personalAccessKey` line present in your `HubSpot.config.yml` file, locally?
If not, re-authenticate by running `hs auth`

Not yet but the new beta is definitely the way to go. I'm currently working on a landing page and can share when that's done. I'd say it's a little bit too early to start using the beta for live projects but they are close.

<@UCBDLK6SU> thank you for your answer, I dig into my issue and I understood some things...

My deployment workflow is set as follows :
• I run `npm run install` to install devDependencies
• I run `npm run build` to generate assets with gulp in dist folder
• I run HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-deploy-action@v1.5 to upload the dist folder
But when I read the logs I see that it runs a `git clean -ffdx` automatically that delete my dist folder

```Then when it run hs upload dist I have the issue The path "dist" is not a path to a file or folder```
I no longer encounter the auth problem, it as been fixed by using the last HubSpot-cms-deploy-action@v1.5

Yep, that’s an issue with v1.5, fixed in v1.6 :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-deploy-action/issues/19>
Great :partying_face: thank you it's working fine
Anyone else keep getting logged out of HubSpot multiple times a day the last few days…
yes, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Account-Settings/2FA-Automatic-log-out-has-been-out-of-control-lately/td-p/745672|thread in community here> - they're working on it

Good morning, I’m seeing a 1 minute wait to download a 200MB PDF using the “Sales > Documents” feature. It seems very slow CDN for a very impatient world. I’m wondering if there is any information as to the expected speeds (I’m on a gigabit in SF).
Hello, when you export a contact from HubSpot, is it possible to also export contacts overview and activities?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1671104604523769>
<@U01QVR44MEY> thanks! This way seems to be a migration to another portal, like a second HubSpot account. Do you think, you can migrate to a csv or json file?
<@U04K1ENJCMB> did you see all the links in that conversation
I would suggest reading up on those conversations, currently getting all the contact activity is pretty challenging
Alright <@U01QVR44MEY> :white_check_mark:
hey folks - is it possible to use blog title inside of a module ? For example, whenever I create  a new blog post, the top section consist of a title, how do I access that title inside a module ?
`{{ content.name }}`
`content.name` is referencing the Blog portion instead of the title! am I missing something here ? :pray:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#blog-variables>
Is there a way to get the "Add" Tab to show when editing a blog post? I want to add modules to my post, but not seeing that tab.
~Unfortunately, adding modules to blog posts via the page editor isn’t currently supported.~
But i was able to, in another account
Try content.html_title ?

Excuse me, it appears you’re correct — which comes as quite the shock to me. It’s been my understanding that this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas#dnd-area|shouldn’t be something you can do in HubSpot blog posts>. But, after checking the accounts I have access to, one of them _is_ able to do so.

However, what has me stumped: I have a copy of the _exact_ same theme on one of my test environments. On that account, I’m _not_ able to add modules on blog posts.

At this point, my best guess is that it might be some sort of A/B or staggered feature roll-out. Apologies for the wrong answer earlier, and I’ll be watching eagerly to see if anyone else knows more.
Thanks for the reply. It has been stumping me too.
